short_summary: General Construction and Maintenance Contract - British Columbia
description: Advance Procurement Notice for a Facilities Management and general construction, maintenance and repair contract with anticipated security requirement regarding a facilities inspection and testing and minor repair services for a communication facility located in Masset, British Columbia, Canada. The contractor will conduct inspections and minor repairs to the facility of an approximate size of 15,920 square feet. The contractor will be required to possess a Facility Security Clearance at the SECRET level granted by the CSP, PWGSC.

### Procurement Title
Advance Procurement Notice for Inspection, Testing, and Minor Repair Services for General Construction, Maintenance, and Repair Work at CFB Esquimalt, Masset, British Columbia (with Security Requirements)

### Solicitation Reference
PW-23-01022936
### Category
Supply and Services

**Background**
 Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites interested consultants to participate in an anticipated procurement for Inspection, Testing, and Minor Repair (ITM) Services at CFB Esquimalt, Masset, British Columbia. This procurement may involve security clearance requirements and is contingent upon project approval.

**Objective**
The objective of this Advance Procurement Notice is to provide interested consultants with an opportunity to begin the sponsorship request process for obtaining the required security clearance(s) that are anticipated. Note that there is no guarantee that this contract will proceed or that any security clearance(s) will be granted in a timely fashion.

**Description of Services**
The contracting authority requires a contractor to provide ITM services as and when required for a communications facility in Masset located on Haida Gwaii, British Columbia. The scope of the contract includes general construction, maintenance, and repair work for the Masset Detachment.

**Services Required**
The contractor will be required to perform the following services:

- Regular/frequent inspection on certain equipment
- Annual testing of transformers and generators
- Quarterly maintenance and filter cleaning of air handling units and HVAC systems
- Quarterly inspection and repair of fire alarm and fire fighting systems.

**Security Requirements**
To be eligible for contract award, the consultant or contractor must actively hold all required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The anticipated security clearance(s) required are:

- Valid and active FACILITY SECURITY CLEARANCE (FSC) at the level of SECRET granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

**Procurement Process**
Consultants interested in submitting a proposal must begin the security clearance application process by applying through DCC’s ISP. DCC may provide preliminary assistance with the security clearance sponsorship process.

**Timeline**
It is anticipated that this procurement will be initiated in April 2023. This is conditional on the project receiving approval to proceed by DND.
